issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

assignee.name: oysteing
assignee.emailAddress: oystein dot grovlen at sun dot com

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I have seen ConcurrentImplicitCreateSchema.java get a lock timeout  periodically and it occurred in the posted sun tests for build 365391

http://www.multinet.no/~solberg/public/Apache/Derby/testlog/CYGWIN_NT-5.2_i686-unknown/365391-derbylang_diff.txt
(I don't know how long this link will last. Below is the diff)

fields.summary: derbylang/ConcurrentImplicitCreateSchema.java fails intermittently with a lock timeout

comments.body: adding to regression suite and raising priority as discussed for regression suite bugs.

I saw this test again fail in a 1/27 build, 372871.  Definitely intermittent as many runs do succeeed.  
Here is the environment (i believe this is a slowish single processor machine):
Generating report for RunSuite derbynetmats  null null DerbyNet true

Java Vendor:     Sun Microsystems Inc.
Java home:       d:\dev\src\jdk142\jre

author.name: oysteing
author.emailAddress: oystein dot grovlen at sun dot com

comments.body:
What I have done with this issue is that I have run the test with some
tracing to see what caused the lock timeouts. I have not quite got to
the bottom of it, but so far it seems to me that it is not a deadlock
scenario, but just timeouts due to long queues on the dictionary lock.
(See below for more info).

Since creating 100 tables in parallel is not a common scenario, I am
not sure whether it is worth the effort to attempt fix this so the
test runs cleanly.  ( The test was made to test a fix (Derby-230) that
I do not think is very likely to reoccur.)  I have suggested on
derby-dev take we should just remove the test from derbyall.  No one
has protested so I will create a patch to do that.

updateAuthor.name: oysteing
updateAuthor.emailAddress: oystein dot grovlen at sun dot com

M      java/testing/org/apache/derbyTesting/functionTests/suites/derbynetmats.runall
